intro: Asystasia ansellioides, commonly known as the silverleaf asystasia, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It is a member of the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its silver-gray foliage and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows as a herbaceous perennial, often found in moist, shaded environments. Its leaves are opposite and ovate, while its flowers are clustered in whorled inflorescences. Asystasia ansellioides is valued in horticulture for its ornamental appeal and ability to thrive in partial shade.
